text: on a package on 1.x.x, to what version number should i bump to?

elements.text: on a package on 1.x.x, to what version number should i bump to?

text: Semantic versioning refers to user-visible API, so changing the layout of an internal structure isn't considered breaking. Of course, if a user hooked into internals, they aren't going to be happy, but hey, that's their fault. In principle a patch bump may be enough, but in these cases a bit of extra care might help and bumping the minor versions isn't bad. Luckily, being already in v1.x gives you the option to play with all three numbers rather than only 2
